answers.answer: It's common, specially quitting smoking, to gain weight. Try a better approach to diet, try to have a small meal every 3 hours, and I mean breakfast, snack, lunch, snack and dinner. I was advised to do so when i was diagnosed with diabetes and lost around 60 pounds.

question: i drank nearly every day from the time i was 15 to the time i was 25, and drank heavily from the time i was 18 to the time i was 25. i "quit" drinking when i was 25, though i have stumbled up my recovery about five times (each was an isolated incident and not a bender.)i did not get any help from AA or any other organization, though i really should - i know this.my problem now, however, is weight gain. not only did i quit drinking, but i also quit smoking and using drugs as well. and, i have put on 50 lbs. in the two years since i quit drinking. is this common? i have dieted and exercised very much with no result. i feel i have no discipline whatsoever. what should i do?
title: weight gain and recovery
